result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in compliance with agency requirements.

Defendant Benjamin M Schultz in court with attorney Emily Bell.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Def is requesting a change of plea date.
Def is in treatment.
Def is requesting a 3 month adjournment.
BTC: 45 day adjournment granted.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin M Schultz in court with attorney Lauren Stuckert.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State is requesting a 30 day adjournment to get offer to def.
BTC: adjournment granted.  Status conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in compliance with agency requirements.

Payment received through Government Payment Express (charge card agency) - $1000   13901096
While treated as being paid immediately, actual posting of payment will occur within 5-10 business days.
Status conference on April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Benjamin M Schultz in court with attorney Lauren Stuckert.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
